Package de.tum.cit.fop.maze

Class HUD

java.lang.Object
de.tum.cit.fop.maze.HUD
public class HUD extends Object
The HUD (Heads-Up Display) class manages and renders the game's user interface elements. It handles information such as the player's lives, score, collected keys, and timers, as well as displaying messages to the player.

  • Constructor Details

    • HUD

      public HUD()
      Constructor for the HUD class. Initializes the font, camera, and game state variables.

  • Method Details

    • setScreenDimensions

      public void setScreenDimensions(float width, float height)
      Sets the dimensions of the screen and updates the HUD camera accordingly.
      Parameters:
      width - The width of the screen.
      height - The height of the screen.

    • updateTimer

      public void updateTimer(float delta)
      Updates the global timer, which tracks the time elapsed in the game.
      Parameters:
      delta - The time in seconds since the last frame.

    • updateScoreTimer

      public void updateScoreTimer(float delta)
      Updates the score timer, which tracks the remaining time before the game ends.
      Parameters:
      delta - The time in seconds since the last frame.

    • stopTimer

      public void stopTimer()
      Stops the timer and records the final time when the game ends.

    • getFinalTime

      public float getFinalTime()
      Gets the final time when the game ends.
      Returns:
      The final time as a float.

    • render

      public void render(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.SpriteBatch batch, Player player)
      Renders the HUD elements such as lives, score, key collected status, and timer. It also displays messages if applicable.
      Parameters:
      batch - The SpriteBatch used for rendering the HUD.
      player - The player object, used to display messages near the player.

    • incrementLives

      public void incrementLives()
      Increments the number of lives by 1.

    • decrementLives

      public void decrementLives()
      Decrements the number of lives by 1 and displays a message.

    • stunMessage

      public void stunMessage()
      Displays a message indicating that the player stunned a griever.

    • needFriend

      public void needFriend()
      Displays a message indicating that the player cannot leave without friends.

    • saveHUDState

      public void saveHUDState()
      Saves the current state of the HUD (lives, score timer, key collected, etc.) to the preferences for persistence between sessions.

    • loadHUDState

      public void loadHUDState()
      Loads the saved state of the HUD from preferences.
